message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR

Reasoning: The paper deals with action detection in videos, which is a problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a new metric for evaluating the performance of models on imbalanced datasets, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper proposes a method for transferring representations from data-rich categories to rare categories, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses the challenges of working with uncurated videos, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
